To determine which Aztec ruler was deposed by Hernán Cortés, we need to consider the historical context of the Spanish conquest of the Aztec Empire. Hernán Cortés arrived in Mexico in 1519 and encountered the Aztec civilization, which was ruled by Moctezuma II at that time. Eventually, Cortés captured Moctezuma and used him as a puppet leader, but he was ultimately killed during the Spanish conquest. After Moctezuma's death, Cortés continued his campaign against the Aztecs, leading to the fall of Tenochtitlán and the end of the Aztec Empire.

Answer: Moctezuma II
